text: <!channel>: Hi everyone, I wanted to share items which the IBM team is focused on over the next week and half. At a high level, Documents for application and Fabric developers Client SDK work, Chaincode access control using tcert attributes, whitelisted members, and stabilizing PBFT consensus and performance. I am publicly broadcasting these items out to open any discussion on these, as well as offer up and encourage anyone interested in jumping in or talking to any of the folks please do so. All feedback is very welcomed. The best way to see specific items is to use this link: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+milestone%3A%22Sprint+5%22>

attachments.title: hyperledger/fabric
attachments.text: fabric - Fabric is a blockchain project in Incubation proposed to the community and documented at <https://goo.gl/RYQZ5N>. Information on what Incubation entails can be found in the Hyperledger Proj...

text: Also any items that were labeled “help wanted” are considered good starter items. So, grab anything you want, and please put a statement in the comment like “I’ll take this one” so one of the maintainers can assign you reducing confusion :simple_smile:

<@U0W7D64LC> I looked at your Sprint5 list and would like to add #1091, #915 and any other issues I open on consensus this week :simple_smile: Those of us trying to do performance characterization are dead-in-the-water as NOOPS is the only “consensus” mechanism that is currently able to withstand stress. Issue #996 also points to a very serious performance or architecture issue, but the issue is not currently marked as a bug.
#1091 #919 are closed ?    can you poke <@U0XPR4NP4>  <@U0XR6J961> or me when you add a comment or issue ?
at the risk of sounding like a broken record,  I need to find a way for us non-committers to add labels and assign people to an issue :simple_smile:
I’m about to add comments to #1091

attachments.title: Security mode throughput is periodic in security.cert.batch.size · Issue #996 · hyperledger/fabric · GitHub
attachments.text: I was asking questions on Slack about the poor system-level throughput with security enabled. @muralisrini suggested setting security.cert.batch.size to 1000 and ignoring the throughput of the init...
